intro: Zaczatea angolensis, commonly known as the Angola grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. The plant features slender,丛生 stems that can reach up to 1 meter in height. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a slightly hairy texture. Zaczatea angolensis produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the grass family.
